Judge<S>8199</S> me, O God<S>430</S>, and plead<S>7378</S> my cause<S>7379</S> against an ungodly<S>3808</S> <S>2623</S> nation<S>1471</S>: O deliver<S>6403</S> me from the deceitful<S>4820</S> and unjust<S>5766</S> man<S>376</S>. <sup>ungodly: or, unmerciful</sup> <sup>the deceitful: Heb. a man of deceit and iniquity</sup>
For thou art the God<S>430</S> of my strength<S>4581</S>: why dost thou cast me off<S>2186</S>? why go<S>1980</S> I mourning<S>6937</S> because of the oppression<S>3906</S> of the enemy<S>341</S>?
O send out<S>7971</S> thy light<S>216</S> and thy truth<S>571</S>: let them lead<S>5148</S> me; let them bring<S>935</S> me unto thy holy<S>6944</S> hill<S>2022</S>, and to thy tabernacles<S>4908</S>.
Then will I go<S>935</S> unto the altar<S>4196</S> of God<S>430</S>, unto God<S>410</S> my exceeding<S>8057</S> joy<S>1524</S>: yea, upon the harp<S>3658</S> will I praise<S>3034</S> thee, O God<S>430</S> my God<S>430</S>. <sup>my exceeding: Heb. the gladness of my joy</sup>
Why art thou cast down<S>7817</S>, O my soul<S>5315</S>? and why art thou disquieted<S>1993</S> within me? hope<S>3176</S> in God<S>430</S>: for I shall yet praise<S>3034</S> him, who is the health<S>3444</S> of my countenance<S>6440</S>, and my God<S>430</S>.
